title: Aadhaar Demographic Monthly Update Data
description: Monthly Aadhaar enrolment and demographic update data by age group and PIN code.
about_dataset: This dataset provides monthly information on Aadhaar enrolments and demographic updates across India, including updates related to name, address, gender, and date of birth. The data is organized by age group and PIN code, enabling analysis of demographic trends, regional patterns, and the scale of Aadhaar update activities. It is useful for policymakers, researchers, and analysts studying population demographics and digital identity coverage in India.
author: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

title: Population Census to SHRUG Identifier Keys
description: Geographic linkage dataset connecting Population Census identifiers with SHRUG spatial units across census years 1991, 2001, and 2011.
about_dataset: This dataset links village, town, sub-district, and district-level Population Census identifiers to SHRUG (shrid) spatial units for the census years 1991, 2001, and 2011. It enables integration of demographic, household, and socioeconomic census data with SHRUG’s spatial framework. The dataset supports longitudinal analysis of population trends, urban-rural classification, census boundary mapping, demographic data linkage, and integration with other datasets such as infrastructure, economic indicators, literacy rates, and health statistics.
author: Development Data Lab

title: Economic Census to SHRUG Identifier Keys
description: Geographic linkage dataset mapping Economic Census identifiers to SHRUG spatial units across multiple census years.
about_dataset: This dataset provides mappings between Economic Census identifiers at village and town levels and SHRUG spatial identifiers (shrid). It covers multiple Economic Census years including 1990, 1998, 2005, and 2013. The dataset enables integration of economic census data with demographic and infrastructure datasets, supporting analysis of firm distribution, employment trends, industrial activity, and urban-rural segmentation across geographic levels. It is particularly useful for spatial economic analysis, census data standardization, and linking economic indicators with other SHRUG datasets such as roads, night lights, and consumption data.
author: Development Data Lab

title: Annual Average IIP – 2-Digit Level (NIC-2004)
description: Annual average Index of Industrial Production (IIP) values for each 2-digit NIC-2004 industrial category in India.
about_dataset: This dataset compiles annual average values of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP) for India, classified at the 2-digit NIC-2004 industrial level. For each sector, it presents the average IIP across full years, smoothing short-term fluctuations. The dataset enables analysts and policymakers to compare relative sectoral performance over time, identify long-term growth or decline trends, and support informed economic policy formulation, industrial development strategies, and resource allocation planning.
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: Growth Rate (Index of Industrial Production)
description: Monthly growth rate data of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), measuring changes in industrial output across sectors such as manufacturing, mining, and electricity.
about_dataset: The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) is a quantitative measure of industrial output based on physical production. This dataset tracks the growth rate of IIP by comparing current monthly production levels with the average monthly production in the base year. It serves as a key indicator of short-term industrial performance and economic health, helping assess trends in core industries and production-based activities across India.
source_org: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
tags: Index of Industrial Production - 2-digit Level Industry Code
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
source_organisation: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: NIC 2-Digit and Sectoral Annual Indices of IIP (Base 2004-05)
description: Annual index values of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP) at the NIC 2-digit level, showing sector-wise industrial output trends across India with base year 2004-05.
about_dataset: This dataset contains yearly index values for industrial output across all major sectors in India, detailed at the 2-digit NIC-2004 classification level with base year 2004-05. It records how production levels have evolved relative to the base year and enables sector-wise trend analysis of industrial growth, performance comparison across industries, and informed economic analysis, industrial strategy formulation, and policy planning.
source_org: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: Important Parliamentary Terms
description: A reference dataset containing important parliamentary terminology used in Indian legislative and parliamentary documents.
about_dataset: This dataset provides a collection of important parliamentary terms commonly used in Indian parliamentary papers and proceedings. It serves as a reference resource for understanding legislative language, administrative terminology, and procedural expressions used by the Parliament of India. The dataset is primarily intended for educational, research, and documentation purposes.
author: Lok Sabha

title: Parliament Consolidated Glossary
description: A consolidated glossary of parliamentary terms used in Indian legislative and parliamentary documents.
about_dataset: This dataset provides a consolidated glossary of parliamentary terminology used by the Parliament of India. It includes definitions and references compiled from official parliamentary documents, helping users understand legislative language, administrative expressions, and procedural terms. The dataset is intended for educational, research, and reference use in governance and parliamentary studies.
author: Lok Sabha
data_collection_method: Compilation of official parliamentary glossary documents

title: Rules of Procedure - Lok Sabha
description: Official rules governing the procedures and conduct of business in the Lok Sabha of the Parliament of India.
about_dataset: This dataset contains the official Rules of Procedure of the Lok Sabha, outlining the legislative processes, conduct of debates, motions, questions, and administrative functioning of the lower house of Parliament. It serves as an authoritative reference for understanding parliamentary operations, legislative workflows, and procedural norms in India.
author: Lok Sabha
data_collection_method: Official parliamentary documentation and procedural records

title: indic_align_wikihow
description: A multilingual parallel corpus derived from WikiHow, containing step-by-step how-to guides aligned across multiple Indian languages.
about_dataset: This dataset is a multilingual parallel corpus translated and aligned into multiple Indian languages from WikiHow. It is designed to support training and evaluation of multilingual and cross-lingual NLP models, including instruction-following systems, language transfer learning, and multilingual task understanding. The dataset is encoded in UTF-8 format and is suitable for large-scale language research and model fine-tuning.
source_org: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
author: Soket AI Labs
source_organisation: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
data_collection_method: Translation and alignment of WikiHow instructional content across multiple Indian languages

title: bhasha-sft_aya_dataset
description: A structured multilingual dataset designed for training and fine-tuning speech recognition and NLP models for Indic languages, derived from the Bhasha SFT (Speech-to-Text) project.
about_dataset: The bhasha-sft dataset, particularly the aya_dataset subset, is a linguistic resource intended to advance machine learning and natural language processing for Indic languages. Sourced from the Bhasha SFT (Speech-to-Text) project, it includes diverse conversational data and text useful for training speech recognition systems, multilingual NLP models, and language understanding pipelines. The dataset is UTF-8 encoded and suitable for large-scale fine-tuning and evaluation.
source_org: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
author: Soket AI Labs
source_organisation: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
data_collection_method: Curated multilingual conversational and speech-to-text data collected under the Bhasha SFT (Speech-to-Text) initiative

title: indic_align_wikihow
description: A multilingual parallel corpus derived from WikiHow, containing aligned step-by-step how-to guides across multiple Indian languages.
about_dataset: The indic_align_wikihow dataset is a large multilingual parallel corpus translated and aligned into several Indian languages. It is designed to support training and evaluation of models for instruction-following, multilingual NLP, cross-lingual transfer learning, and language research. Derived from WikiHow’s repository of step-by-step guides, the dataset is UTF-8 encoded and suitable for large-scale multilingual language model training and evaluation.
source_org: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
author: Soket AI Labs
source_organisation: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
data_collection_method: Translated and aligned multilingual text corpus derived from WikiHow step-by-step instructional content

title: MEPMA – SHG Product Details Online Orders
description: District-wise list of SHG manufactured products and online orders across e-commerce platforms.
about_dataset: This dataset provides detailed information on products manufactured by Urban Self Help Groups (SHGs) and the online orders received through district-wise seller points across various e-commerce platforms such as MyStore and WoW Gene under the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). The dataset is intended to support AI-based and data-driven solutions to improve market access, visibility, and sales opportunities for SHG products.
source_org: Mission for Elimination of Poverty in Municipal Areas
author: MEPMA
source_organisation: Mission for Elimination of Poverty in Municipal Areas
data_collection_method: District-wise reporting of SHG product listings and online order data from e-commerce platforms integrated with ONDC

title: Telangana District and Mandal Geospatial Shapefiles
description: Geospatial shapefiles for administrative boundaries of Telangana, including district and mandal (sub-district) level divisions.
about_dataset: This dataset provides official geospatial boundary shapefiles for Telangana’s revenue administration, covering 33 districts and 632 mandals (sub-districts). The shapefiles are suitable for spatial analysis, GIS-based governance applications, district-wise planning, infrastructure development, and administrative mapping. The dataset is publicly available under the Open Government Data License, India.
author: Open Data Telangana
data_collection_method: Administrative geospatial data compiled and published by the Telangana state open data initiative

title: Web Map Service (WMS) from Survey of India OSM Data
description: Progress data on the Digital India Land Records Modernization Programme (DILRMP) across Indian states and UTs, showing computerized land records and records of rights.
about_dataset: This dataset presents the progress of the Digital India Land Records Modernization Programme (DILRMP), a central sector scheme launched on April 1, 2016. It focuses on digitizing land records across all Indian States and Union Territories. Implemented by the Department of Land Resources (DoLR) through State Revenue and Registration Departments, the dataset tracks key components such as Computerization of Land Records (CLR) and digitization of Records of Rights (RoR). The dataset provides numeric indicators reflecting the extent of implementation at the state and UT level and is accessible via Web Map Service (WMS).
author: Chief Data Officer
data_collection_method: Administrative data collected from state and UT land record digitization systems under the DILRMP programme

title: National Accounts – Key Aggregates
description: Annual macroeconomic indicators of the Indian economy including GDP, GVA, NDP, GNI, CFC, and major expenditure aggregates.
about_dataset: This dataset provides annual national accounts statistics for India, covering key aggregates such as Gross Domestic Product (GDP), Gross Value Added (GVA), Net Domestic Product (NDP), Gross National Income (GNI), Consumption of Fixed Capital (CFC), and expenditure-side aggregates. It supports economic analysis, policy formulation, and macroeconomic research.
author: Chief Data Officer

title: All India Consumer Price Index Numbers
description: Consumer Price Index (CPI) data for Industrial Workers, Rural Labourers, Agricultural Labourers, and CPI-New series for Rural, Urban, and All-India.
about_dataset: This dataset provides Consumer Price Index (CPI) numbers based on different base years, covering Industrial Workers (food, non-food, and general), Rural Labourers, and Agricultural Labourers since the mid-1990s. It also includes the CPI-New series for Rural, Urban, and All-India with base year 2010, supporting inflation analysis, economic research, and policy planning.
author: Ministry of Finance

title: Consumer Price Index (CPI)
description: Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures retail price changes of household goods and services, while the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) focuses on food price movements.
about_dataset: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) tracks changes over time in the general level of prices of goods and services consumed by households. It reflects cost-of-living patterns across rural, urban, and combined sectors. The Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) is derived from CPI sub-groups and captures food inflation trends. This dataset is essential for inflation analysis, economic planning, and policy formulation.
source_org: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
source_organisation: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: CPI October 2022: State Level Consumer Price Index (Rural/Urban)
description: State-level monthly Consumer Price Index (CPI) data for rural, urban, and combined sectors across India up to October 2022.
about_dataset: This dataset, released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI), presents state-wise Consumer Price Index (CPI) figures for Rural, Urban, and Combined categories from January 2011 to October 2022, based on the 2012=100 base year. It covers major consumption groups such as food and beverages, housing, fuel and light, enabling granular regional inflation analysis and comparative economic insights.
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: CPI October 2022: All India Consumer Price Index (Rural/Urban) upto October 2022
description: Monthly Consumer Price Index (CPI) data for rural, urban, and combined regions across India, covering January to October 2022. Useful for inflation analysis and economic trend monitoring.
about_dataset: This dataset, published by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI), provides the All India Consumer Price Index (CPI) for Rural, Urban, and Combined segments from January to October 2022. The CPI reflects changes in the general price level of goods and services consumed by households, serving as a key indicator for inflation tracking and policy formulation. The data includes indices for major consumption categories such as Food and Beverages, Housing, Fuel and Light, and more, based on the 2012=100 base year. It is instrumental for economists, analysts, and policymakers to assess inflationary trends and regional price dynamics.
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: CPI November 2022: State Level Consumer Price Index (Rural/Urban)
description: State-level monthly Consumer Price Index (CPI) values for rural, urban, and combined regions across Indian states and union territories, up to November 2022.
about_dataset: This dataset provides monthly CPI figures (base year 2012 = 100) for rural, urban, and combined populations across every Indian state and union territory, up to November 2022. Compiled by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) / National Statistical Office (NSO), it includes both the general Consumer Price Index (CPI) and the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI). Sourced from over 1,100 urban markets and 1,180 villages, the dataset reflects regional price dynamics and month-over-month inflation trends. It is essential for economists, policymakers, researchers, and analysts studying state-level economic conditions and inflation patterns.
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: CPI November 2022: All India Consumer Price Index (Rural/Urban) upto November 2022
description: All-India monthly Consumer Price Index (CPI) values for rural and urban areas, tracking inflation up to November 2022. Based on the reference year 2012 = 100, it reflects national-level price trends.
about_dataset: This dataset offers monthly CPI data (base year 2012 = 100) for rural, urban, and combined India up to November 2022, compiled by the National Statistical Office (NSO) under the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI). It includes both the general Consumer Price Index (CPI) and the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI), capturing detailed inflation metrics across food, housing, transport and other consumption groups. Price information was collected from around 1,114 urban markets and 1,181 villages, making this a comprehensive national dataset for month-to-month and year-on-year inflation analysis. It is valuable for economists, policymakers, researchers and analysts studying inflation dynamics and cost-of-living trends across India.
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: CPI May 2023: State Level Consumer Price Index (Rural/Urban)
description: State-level monthly Consumer Price Index (CPI) values for rural and urban areas across all Indian states, up to May 2023. Based on 2012 = 100, it reflects regional inflation trends.
about_dataset: This dataset offers monthly CPI values (base 2012 = 100) separately for rural and urban regions of each Indian state and union territory up to May 2023, compiled by MoSPI/NSO. It includes the general Consumer Price Index (CPI) for all goods and services and the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI), enabling detailed regional inflation analysis. Data collection spans over 1,100 urban markets and numerous villages, providing granular sub-national insights into price dynamics. The dataset is useful for economists, policymakers, researchers, and analysts studying state-wise cost-of-living variations, inflationary pressures, and regional price trends.
author: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

title: Accidents Classified according to nature of accidents during 2014
description: This dataset contains state/UT-wise records of road accidents in India classified by driver profile, weather, road condition, and other key factors.
about_dataset: The dataset presents detailed statistics on road accidents across Indian states and union territories, segmented by variables such as educational qualifications of drivers, type of junction, traffic control mechanisms, vehicle condition, weather, location, age of vehicles, and more. It includes total number of accidents, fatalities, and injuries.
author: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: Accidents classified according to road condition during 2014
description: This dataset contains state/UT-wise records of road accidents in India classified by driver profile, weather, road condition, and other key factors.
about_dataset: The dataset presents detailed statistics on road accidents across Indian states and union territories, segmented by variables such as educational qualifications of drivers, type of junction, traffic control mechanisms, vehicle condition, weather, location, age of vehicles, and more. It includes total number of accidents, fatalities, and injuries.
author: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: Accidents Classified according to type of location during 2014
description: This dataset contains state/UT-wise records of road accidents in India classified by driver profile, weather, road condition, and other key factors.
about_dataset: The dataset presents detailed statistics on road accidents across Indian states and union territories, segmented by variables such as educational qualifications of drivers, type of junction, traffic control mechanisms, vehicle condition, weather, location, age of vehicles, and more. It includes total number of accidents, fatalities, and injuries.
author: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: Accidents Classified according to Type of Weather Condition during 2014
description: This dataset contains state/UT-wise records of road accidents in India classified by driver profile, weather, road condition, and other key factors.
about_dataset: The dataset presents detailed statistics on road accidents across Indian states and union territories, segmented by variables such as educational qualifications of drivers, type of junction, traffic control mechanisms, vehicle condition, weather, location, age of vehicles, and more. It includes total number of accidents, fatalities, and injuries.
author: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: Accidents, Persons killed and injured classified according to type of Manoeuvre during 2014
description: This dataset contains state/UT-wise records of road accidents in India classified by driver profile, weather, road condition, and other key factors.
about_dataset: The dataset presents detailed statistics on road accidents across Indian states and union territories, segmented by variables such as educational qualifications of drivers, type of junction, traffic control mechanisms, vehicle condition, weather, location, age of vehicles, and more. It includes total number of accidents, fatalities, and injuries.
author: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: 2011 population census district polygon geometries
description: A geospatial dataset containing polygon geometries for districts in India as per the 2011 Population Census.
about_dataset: The PC11 District Polygons Dataset provides district-level administrative boundary geometries derived from open-source geospatial maps. These polygons represent true district boundaries from the 2011 Census, allowing researchers to analyze district-level trends in demographics, infrastructure, and policy implementation. These maps have been compiled from multiple sources, including SEDAC, Bharatmapps, Datameet, and the Administrative Atlas of India, ensuring extensive geographic coverage. While some inaccuracies exist (up to 1 km measurement error in certain areas), these maps are among the most accurate available for open-access use.
author: Dev Data Lab

title: 2011 population census state polygon geometries
description: A geospatial dataset containing polygon geometries for state boundaries in India as per the 2011 Population Census.
about_dataset: The PC11 State Polygons Dataset provides state-level boundary geometries based on the 2011 Census administrative boundaries. These polygons allow researchers, policymakers, and analysts to visualize state-wise spatial data, track economic and infrastructure development, and perform regional planning and governance analysis. These maps are compiled from multiple open-source datasets, and though they have minor geometric errors, they are highly useful for spatial statistics, governance planning, and inter-state comparisons.
author: Dev Data Lab

title: 6th Minor Irrigation Census - Village Schedule, Ground Water Schemes, Surface Water Schemes
description: Village-level data from the 6th Minor Irrigation Census covering ground and surface water irrigation schemes.
about_dataset: The dataset has village-wise information from the 6th Minor Irrigation Census, focusing on ground water and surface water schemes used for irrigation across India. It includes data on source types, scheme ownership, usage status, command area, and technical details of minor irrigation systems. The census supports effective planning, monitoring, and policymaking for sustainable water resource management and agricultural productivity improvement.
geographical_coverage: Andaman and Nicobar Island (UT), Andhra Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Bihar, Chandigarh (UT), Chhattisgarh, Delhi (NCT), Goa, Gujarat, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir (UT), Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Odisha, Puducherry (UT), Punjab, Rajasthan, Sikkim, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Tripura, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, West Bengal
author: Department of Water Resources, River Development & Ganga Rejuvenation

title: 2011 population census village-level geometries
description: A geospatial dataset containing polygon geometries for villages and towns in India as per the 2011 Census.
about_dataset: The PC11 Village Polygons Dataset provides detailed village- and town-level boundaries across India, based on 2011 Census geographic identifiers. This dataset is a critical resource for rural planning, land use analysis, and socio-economic studies. The village polygons were created using common location codes from multiple open-source sources, ensuring the best alignment possible with official census boundaries. However, due to the complexity of Indian village maps, some minor positional errors (within ~1 km) may exist. These maps are ideal for mapping rural infrastructure, agricultural distribution, and village-level policy studies.
author: Dev Data Lab

title: Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) Night Lights Data (1992–2013)
description: The DMSP Night Lights Dataset (1992–2013) provides satellite-derived night light intensity data to track electrification, economic activity, and urbanization trends from 1992 to 2013.
about_dataset: The DMSP Night Lights Dataset (1992–2013) provides satellite-derived night light intensity data, widely used as a proxy for economic activity, infrastructure development, and electrification levels. The dataset is based on DMSP-OLS satellite observations, which detect artificial lights, fires, and other luminous sources at night across different geographic scales. Each pixel in this dataset represents the sum of light intensities detected in a region, with values ranging from 0 to 63. The dataset includes aggregated light intensity metrics at Shrid, District, Subdistrict, and Assembly Constituency (AC07 & AC08) levels, enabling detailed spatial analysis. Users can analyze total night light emissions, mean and maximum pixel values, and satellite-specific variations. This dataset is valuable for urbanization studies, economic research, disaster impact assessments, and infrastructure planning. However, due to sensor saturation issues in highly illuminated areas, it is recommended to use this dataset in combination with VIIRS Night Lights (2012–2021) for more recent high-resolution data.
author: Dev Data Lab

title: SHRUG Village-Level Polygon Geometries
description: A set of polygon geometries for SHRUG-defined shrids (unique village-level spatial units), including quality control metadata.
about_dataset: The Shrid Polygons Dataset provides polygon geometries for SHRUG (Standardized Human and Regional Geography) shrid units, enabling fine-grained spatial analysis at the village and town levels. These polygons align with 2011 Census village boundaries, allowing for detailed research on economic activities, infrastructure, and spatial inequalities. Unlike standard village boundaries, shrids are uniquely defined within the SHRUG framework, making this dataset particularly useful for integrating spatial data with other SHRUG datasets. Quality control fields are included to help users evaluate data accuracy.
author: Dev Data Lab

title: Oral Cancer Imaging and Clinical Dataset
description: A comprehensive dataset containing clinical, radiological, and histopathological images related to oral cavity, tongue, and jaw pathologies, focusing on oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) and oral potentially malignant disorders (OPMDs).
about_dataset: The Dural-Based Lesion Research Dataset is a nationwide initiative integrating clinical, imaging, and pathological data on dural-based lesions such as meningiomas, inflammatory lesions, and neoplasms. Led by AIIMS, New Delhi, in collaboration with major medical institutions like NIMHANS, PGIMER, and SGPGI, the project aims to develop standardized datasets for comparative analysis of treatment modalities, including Gamma Knife Radiosurgery (GKRS) and microsurgery. The dataset includes 500 dural-based lesion cases from hub centers and 100 each from spoke centers, along with 5000–6000 MRI sequences, histological images, and annotated radiological data. A central focus is on AI-based diagnostic tool development, enhancing predictive accuracy and uniformity in medical imaging analysis. Ethical considerations are strictly followed, with approval from institutional ethics committees ensuring data privacy and security.
author: AIIMS New Delhi, SRHER Chennai

title: NidaanKosha-100k-V1
description: A comprehensive laboratory investigation dataset of 100,000 Indian subjects with 6.8 million+ readings.
about_dataset:
NidaanKosha is an extensive repository containing laboratory investigation readings from 100,000 lab reports collected across diverse diagnostic facilities throughout India. This comprehensive dataset represents a curated collection of data extracted through Eka Care’s Parrotlet vision LLM, which automatically parses images and PDFs to extract structured health information. The dataset contains approximately 6.8 million individual investigation readings, each mapped to standardized LOINC identifiers for interoperability.

See the full description on the dataset page: https://huggingface.co/datasets/ekacare/NidaanKosha-100k-V1.0
author: EkaCare

title: Dural-Based Lesion Research Dataset
description: A multi-institutional dataset focused on dural-based lesions, including clinical, imaging, surgical, and pathological data. It aims to enhance diagnostic accuracy and treatment evaluation using AI-assisted analysis.
about_dataset: The Dural-Based Lesion Research Dataset is a nationwide initiative integrating clinical, imaging, and pathological data on dural-based lesions such as meningiomas, inflammatory lesions, and neoplasms. Led by AIIMS, New Delhi, in collaboration with major medical institutions like NIMHANS, PGIMER, and SGPGI, the project aims to develop standardized datasets for comparative analysis of treatment modalities, including Gamma Knife Radiosurgery (GKRS) and microsurgery. The dataset includes 500 dural-based lesion cases from hub centers and 100 each from spoke centers, along with 5000–6000 MRI sequences, histological images, and annotated radiological data. A central focus is on AI-based diagnostic tool development, enhancing predictive accuracy and uniformity in medical imaging analysis. Ethical considerations are strictly followed, with approval from institutional ethics committees ensuring data privacy and security.
author: AIIMS Bhubaneswar, AIIMS New Delhi, KGMU Lucknow, NIMHANS Bengaluru, PGIMER Chandigarh, SCIMST Kerala, SGPGI Lucknow

title: Blood Bank Directory (updated till last month)
description: Data contains state/city wise list of blood banks in India.
about_dataset: Data contains state/city wise list of blood banks and other required information like address, geo location, contact details, area pin code, email address, website link, etc. The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India has set up the National Health Portal in pursuance to the decisions of the National Knowledge Commission, to provide healthcare related information to the citizens of India.
author: Chief Data Officer

title: Pheezee Analytical Report - Neuro Condition
description: This dataset contains patient report from the Pheezee device focused on neurological conditions.
about_dataset: This dataset contains patient report from the Pheezee device focused on neurological conditions. It records objective data on muscle activation (sEMG) and joint mobility (ROM) during rehabilitation exercises. Key metrics include movement range, muscle recruitment, asymmetry between limbs, and session-wise progress. The reports help assess motor function in conditions like stroke, cerebral palsy, spinal cord injuries, and Parkinson’s disease, supporting personalized therapy, outcome tracking, and evidence-based care.
author: STARTOON LABS PRIVATE LIMITED

title: arc-indic
description: Arc Challenge translated to Indic.
about_dataset: Indic ARC Dataset is a multilingual version of the ARC Challenge Set, translated from English into 10 Indian languages. ARC is a collection of grade-school science questions that require complex reasoning to solve. Languages covered in the dataset include translations in the following languages: Bengali (bn), Gujarati (gu), Hindi (hi), Kannada (kn), Marathi (mr), Malayalam (ml), Oriya (or), Punjabi (pa), Tamil (ta), and Telugu (te). Dataset format: Each example follows the ARC Challenge structure. See the full description on the dataset page: https://huggingface.co/datasets/sarvamai/arc-challenge-indic.
author: sarvamai
